org.sliderule.stats

Interface IStatistics

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AStatistics, OfflineStatistics, OnlineStatistics

    public interface IStatistics
    This interface is intended to provide a common description of the methods required (but not their implementations) for analyzing samples of a random variable.
    See Also:
    • Wikipedia: Variance
    • Wikipedia: Arithmetic mean
    • DeGroot, Morris H., and Schervish, Mark J. Probability and Statistics, 3rd Edition. Toronto: Addison-Wesley, 2002. pp. 429. Print.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double[] data()
      Return the backing data set that this IStatistics represents.
      double highest()
      The highest valued datum contained within the data set that this IStatistics represents.
      double lowest()
      The least valued datum contained within the data set that this IStatistics represents.
      double mean()
      Calculate the arithmetic mean of the data set that this IStatistics represents.
      double[] orderedData()
      Return the backing data set that this IStatistics represents.
      int size()
      The size of the data set.
      double standardDeviation()
      Calculate the standard deviation (or sample deviation) of the data set that this IStatistics represents.
      double variance()
      Calculate the variance of the data set that this IStatistics represents.

    • Method Detail

      • data

        double[] data()
        Return the backing data set that this IStatistics represents. The data is returned with the original sample order preserved.
        Returns:
        the data

      • highest

        double highest()
        The highest valued datum contained within the data set that this IStatistics represents.
        Returns:
        the highest value

      • lowest

        double lowest()
        The least valued datum contained within the data set that this IStatistics represents.
        Returns:
        the lowest value

      • mean

        double mean()
        Calculate the arithmetic mean of the data set that this IStatistics represents.
        Returns:
        the mean

      • orderedData

        double[] orderedData()
        Return the backing data set that this IStatistics represents. The data is returned sorted from lowest to highest in natural numeric order.
        Returns:
        the ordered data

      • size

        int size()
        The size of the data set.
        Returns:
        the size

      • standardDeviation

        double standardDeviation()
        Calculate the standard deviation (or sample deviation) of the data set that this IStatistics represents.
        Returns:
        the variance

      • variance

        double variance()
        Calculate the variance of the data set that this IStatistics represents.
        Returns:
        the variance
